item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy New Year 2025 (729 points | 174 comments)
2. C "clockwise/spiral" rule to understand declarations (12 points | 7 comments)
3. Static search trees: faster than binary search (353 points | 104 comments)
4. An Unreasonable Amount of Time (128 points | 12 comments)
5. Arnis: Generate cities in Minecraft from OpenStreetMap (321 points | 51 comments)
6. I got promoted to staff engineer twice (63 points | 44 comments)
7. Nvidia bets on robotics to drive future growth (74 points | 45 comments)
8. The GTA III port for the Dreamcast has been released (342 points | 99 comments)
9. Large Concept Models: Language modeling in a sentence representation space (73 points | 17 comments)
10. Déjà vu: Ghostly CVEs in my terminal title (109 points | 26 comments)
11. I Reversed a Drone and Landed It with My PC (103 points | 21 comments)
12. Cesium for Unreal – Bring the Real World to Unreal Engine (28 points | discuss)
13. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (667 points | 450 comments)
14. FBI: Largest homemade explosives cache in agency history found in Virginia (98 points | 102 comments)
15. Lucy: A concise language for describing Finite State Machines (39 points | 2 comments)
16. Books I Loved Reading in 2024 (4 points | discuss)
17. Building Game Prototypes with LÖVE (134 points | 51 comments)
18. After a 24-second test of its engines, the New Glenn rocket is ready to fly (51 points | 58 comments)
19. Celestial Phenomena in 16th-Century Germany (10 points | discuss)
20. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (380 points | 331 comments)
21. Bench.co acquired after informing staff company was insolvent (53 points | 30 comments)
22. Frequency shifts do not imply quantum entanglement (2022) (5 points | discuss)
23. Penrose Mazes (2020) (81 points | 10 comments)
24. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (339 points | 152 comments)
25. The psychonaut field manual [pdf] (51 points | 16 comments)
26. Revisiting the NetBSD Build System (105 points | 13 comments)
27. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (386 points | 315 comments)
28. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (331 points | 200 comments)
29. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (627 points | 209 comments)
30. 3D-printed neighborhood nears completion in Texas (34 points | 47 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
